page.title: 10HAWICK FIRE STATION.
page.content: The Hawick Fire Station was built in l973. Everyone of the firemen in Hawick enjoy their job very much. Some of the men have had accidents in fires themselves and have been injured. The shifts are called watches and the four colours of watches are red, white, blue and green. There are seven men in each watch so that means there are 28 men in the whole of the Hawick fire service. There are three fire engines in Hawick, one is manned by a whole time crew and two are manned by a part time crew. The fire engines get called out roughly l2 to 2O times in a month. Sometimes on the way to a fire the fire engine can have a puncture. There have been crashes but Hawick has been fortunate in this respect.
